subtitle: Yes, food speeds up recovery
title: Can I feed my sick baby?
content:
Created by BabyCenter



Food is what your baby needs to get her strength back.

All babies get sick sometimes. It is sad to see your baby sick, but you can help her to get well by giving her the right care and treatment, and by continuing to feed her well.

If your baby is less than 6 months old, your breastmilk will help her to get better. Your breastmilk is healthy. It will help your baby get stronger. If your baby has loose stools or diarrhea,, breastmilk is gentle for  her stomach, and will give your baby her all the nutrients she is losing while she is sick.

If your baby is over 6 months old, continue to feed her mashed family foods. Add a little butter or oil to make it even better. Even if she is vomiting or has diarrhea, she still needs to eat. Food will help her to recover.

If  your baby refuses to eat, offer her small amounts of food, often, through the day. This will help her body to recover.

If your baby is still sick after a day, or the diarrhea lasts longer than a day, take her to the healthcare provider.

When your baby begins to feel better, offer her 2 extra meals a day for 2 weeks. This will help her get back to her usual health.

[Diarrhea in babies][1]


  [1]: http://www.babycenter.com/0_diarrhea-in-babies_82.bc?page=2#articlesection3
